videoJson.name: Betamax
videoJson.manufacturers: Sony, Sanyo, Toshiba, Pioneer, Murphy, Aiwa, NEC, Zenith Electronics, WEGA, Sears, Quelle, RadioShack
videoJson.capacity:
BI: 90 minutes
BII: 200 minutes
BIII: 5 hours
videoJson.fact1: This was the central format in a U.S. Supreme Court case that determined home videotaping of television and movies was legal, ruling against film industry corporations
videoJson.fact2: This format famously "lost" the consumer market to VHS, a more open and cheaper format that debuted with longer initial storage capacity (120 versus 60 minutes)
videoJson.fact3: The format was named after the shape of the lowercase Greek letter beta (β) because it resembles the course of the tape running through a playback device
